result.execSummary:
The defendant Calvin L. Conley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Still DOC Collect - revoked sent prison/extended supervision.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs, DNA Surcharges, and Domestic Abuse Surcharge. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Vacate civil judgment of fine/costs - Defendant is in prison (DOC collect)

Final Reminder Notice with request to pay in full or set up payment plan has been sent to the Defendant's address in the file as of this date. 
Failure to pay or set up payment plan--warrant to be issued.

ADDRESS INFO for Calvin L. Conley
Current: 1411 Melissa Court, Plover, WI 54467 United States  (Effective: 10-03-2016)
Prior: 635 Ceape Street, Oshkosh, WI 54901 United States

ADDRESS INFO for Calvin L. Conley
Current: 635 Ceape Street, Oshkosh, WI 54901 United States  (Effective: 08-22-2016)
Prior: 1411 Melissa Ct, Plover, WI 54467

Defendant Calvin L Conley in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Defendant Calvin L Conley in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 15CM283, 15CM431 (Plea/sentencing), 15CM502 (Return on Warrant/Initial, Plea/sentencing)
9:41 a.m.  Court calls the cases. 

15CM502: 
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 

15CM283 Counts 1 & 2 - NO CONTEST
15CM431 Counts 1, 4 & 5 - NO CONTEST
15CM502 Count 1 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CM283 Counts 1 & 2, 15CM431 Counts 1, 4 & 5, 15CM502 Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Dismissed and read-in are: 15CM502 and 15CM431 Counts 2 & 3

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Halverson makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
24 months prison with 13 months initial confinement followed by 11 months extended supervision STAYED all running concurrent with each other.
Placed on probation for a period of 36 months running concurrent with each other: 
Pay costs including the DNA and (Domestic Abuse surcharge only in 15CM283)
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with all requirements of his agent with respect to all conditions of probation. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
No violent or abusive contact with Jennifer Nilsen or Alison Buss. 
Provide a DNA sample. 
Counseling as deemed necessary and comply with counseling. 
Make restitution in 15CM431 of $244.00.  

Atty Constable addresses jail credit.

BY THE COURT:  
In 15CM283 - 64 days credit
In 15CM431 - 2 days credit
In 15CM502 -1 day credit

State has complied with Victim Rights Notification.
to Amend Bond: from no contact to no violent or abusive contact. /s/RB 10-19-15
CAP Services: Personalized Family Safety Plan and wants contact filed by: J. Nilsen
Total $550.00 - $150 paid + $400.00 balance on wage assignment at $100 per paycheck until $400 on file with the Clerk of Court.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
2:31 p.m. Attorney Acalia Halverson in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Calvin L. Conley appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Cass W Cousins appeared for State of Wisconsin.   Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Cash bond:  Total $550 and First $150 cash and then remainder by wage assignment in the amount of $100 out of every check starting July 9, 2015.  No contact with Jennifer Nilsen, only one time as a phone conversation as to get the defendant's minor child and No contact with Allison Buss with the one exception only for child exchange and to happen in the public places such as library, gas station.   Must maintain Absolute sobriety. 
***10-19-15: Amend Bond: from no contact to no violent or abusive contact with Jennifer Nilsen.****

FTR:  1:35:26 ADA Constables  appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA  states facts for anticipated charges of Disorderly Conduct (Domestic Abuse).
Court asks for clarification of the ADA re: charges
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a cash bond $500  with conditions as stated.
Defendant makes statement re: bond.  Court questions whether he is on a probation hold.  Court questions the defendant

BTC:
Cash bond:  Total $550 and First $150 cash and then remainder by wage assignment in the amount of $100 out of every check starting July 9, 2015.  No contact with Jennifer Nilsen, only one time as a phone conversation as to get the defendant's minor child and No contact with Allison Buss with the one exception only for child exchange and to happen in the public places such as library, gas station.   Must maintain Absolute sobriety

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  7-13-15  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 1
